answerText: phthalimide [10] Potassium phthalimide is reacted with an alkyl halide to form a primary amine in this reaction.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Wellesley + Hunter  | 6 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This compound is a benzene ring with two carbonyls on adjacent carbons and those carbonyls' carbons are bound to a common nitrogen in a secondary amine configuration. For 10 points each: [10]  Name this compound whose variants are reacted with hydrazine in the Ing-Manske procedure.
